name: Kid? Keisatsu Patlabor: 98-Shiki Kid? seyo!
description:
One of several games based on the Mobile Police Patlabor manga and anime franchise, 98-Shiki Kid? seyo! (Launch, Type-98!) is an original scenario where the player takes the role of a new Division 2 recruit. Shortly after the player joins up, a silent military coup attacks their headquarters, and the new recruit must work together with the other Division 2 members to stop it.

The game is structured as a hybrid Japanese-style RPG/adventure game. The player moves and fights in a traditional RPG style, but entering certain locations switches the game to a command-adventure style where the player can ask characters about different subjects, investigate items of interest, and collect and use a wide variety of items. At first the player controls only the recruit, but other characters later join the player's party.

shot.caption: Funny how they portrayed technology back then.
Lookin' good with that polished metal shell.
The memories just come flowing back. This top down view brings me back to old favorites like Dragon Quest (and it's wondrous rip-off, Juvei Quest!).
Oh, it's the Black Chickens of Death. So THIS is where the Black Plague really started... poor rats got all the blame though.
Always wash your hands before piloting giant robots.
I remember getting dizzy with all that green forced upon me...
